metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28192 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: NVIDIA vGPU software contains a vulnerability in the Virtual GPU Manager(nvidia.ko), where it may lead to a use-after-free, which in turn may causedenial of service. This attack is complex to carry out because the attackerneeds to have control over freeing some host side resources out ofsequence, which requires elevated privileges.

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-304: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-304-updates: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-340: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-384 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
